Con: the art is heavily ai generated and they want you to pay for a lot of the customization or different affirmations. Basically anything that‚Äôs not the base app is a payment, which I wouldn‚Äôt find an issue with except the art isn‚Äôt even from a real artist and you can TELL it‚Äôs very badly generated ai images which isn‚Äôt the best look when you can generate ai images for free and you‚Äôre making users pay for that image. data.title: Cancel? Impossible!
data.content: Tried to cancel this app before the 3 day trial ended. I wasn‚Äôt shown as being enrolled and affirmations weren‚Äôt sending. Sure enough, on day 4 more affirmations than I even set up for my daily feed started rolling through and despite traveling everywhere I could think of on both days 3 and 4, there is no customer service/cancellation to be found. Make sure your phone settings let you cancel from there if you want the option for a trial. And know your trial will not reflect the services they promise in this app. I am so irritated by seeing affirmations pop up after I tried to cancel this service I will likely delete the whole app despite having paid a ridiculous $69 for it.

data.title: No way to contact creators?
data.content:
I have had this app for a week. I canceled the subscription. (Which should mean that I can keep using as I was until subscription is over.. in a years time).  But, I paid around $75 for positive attentions being sent to me every day? And, that‚Äôs it? And, Apperantly, it won‚Äôt record any of my data anymore service I cancelled my subscripttionthat doesn‚Äôt end for another flipping year!!! 

There is no way of contacting them and I really don‚Äôt see the benefit of passing close to $80/year to have priorice afternoons sent to you every day‚Ä¶ nothing else‚Ä¶ I don‚Äôt get it. Let me know if there is more. Bernice, I just don‚Äôt see it‚Ä¶and I‚Äôm mad that I spent so much money for so little.
